results.title: Judge Dredd for Commodore 64/128
results.creator_credit: Melbourne House and Laser Beam (Beam Software)
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover, manual and plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Judge Dredd [computer game]. Judge Dredd is a single player action platformer. Players move Dredd to locations of crime as they appear on the sector map and select the crime they wish to pass judgement on. Once a crime has been selected, Dredd is dropped into a side scrolling platformer where both perps and civilians roam. Each crime is given an appropriate response level of Halt, Warn and Kill, though it is up to player discretion to change the response level. Depending on the response level is the action Dredd can perform, either shouting halt, firing warning shots or firing real bullets. Dredd can select a type of bullet from normal, armour piercing, incendiary, ricochet, high explosive and heat seeking.

results.title: Asterix and the Magic Cauldron for Spectrum 48/128
results.creator_credit: Melbourne House and Laser Beam (Beam Software)
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover and plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description:
Asterix and the Magic Cauldron is a single player adventure arcade game. Players control Asterix through various maps, collecting keys for locked doors and fighting Romans and boars in search of seven pieces of Getafix’s Magic Cauldron. Fights take place on a separate screen mode. Stamina bars for each combatant appear on the side of the window. Defeating the combatant adds it to the food tally. If Asterix loses the fight, the window closes and he loses a life. The same system is used when fighting the Roman soldiers and when Asterix picks up objects.

Obelix will only follow if Asterix has a supply of hams which can be obtained from fighting boars. Asterix starts with five lives and one dose of Magic Potion per game, which can be activated by double tapping the fire button.

Original game developed by Beam Software for ZX Spectrum 48K, published in 1986 by Melbourne House.

Source: Play It Again website: http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/asterix-and-the-magic-cauldron/

Last accessed: 1/05/2021

results.title: Knuckle Busters for Commodore 64/128
results.creator_credit: Melbourne House and Laser Beam (Beam Software)
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover and packing foam in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Knuckle Busters [computer game]. Knuckle Busters is a single player side scrolling action platformer. Players take on the role of Deke, a criminal escaping from a prision facility. Due to Deke’s tampering with the Central Computer, the facility and the city are expected to blow up, thus putting a time limit on the players. Players can jump and drop from platforms, avoid or fight androids, collect items and health from barrels and open doors. Deke’s condition is displayed to the player on a pop up menu including lives left, score, time count down, energy level and current object carried.

Deke’s condition is displayed to the player on a pop up menu including lives left, score, time count down, energy level and current object carried.

results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover, badge and manual in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: The Muncher [computer game]. The Muncher is a single player side scrolling action game. Players control a rampaging monster destroying buildings by climbing on them, breathing fire and jumping on people and cars while attempting to avoid getting shot at by people with guns. The game ends when the monster’s health has been depleted by being attacked.

results.title: America's Cup Challenge for Amstrad
results.creator_credit: Armchair Entertainment, US Gold Pty Ltd and Micro Forte Studios
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover and manual in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description:
America’s Cup Challenge is a one to two player competitive sports simulation. The included manual contains a lot of information about the America’s Cup including yachting terminology, race legs, wind angles, sails and weather conditions. The player controls the crew of a racing yacht using the joystick, chosing the type of sail at the start of the race and then switching between three different modes, helmsman, sails selection and winching. As Helmsman, players control the yacht’s direction. Sail selection allows players to move the angle of the sail’s boom and the level of use of the spinnaker or genoa. The manual advises the use of a good quality robust joystick.

Source: Play It Again website: http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/arnies-americas-cup-challenge/
Last accessed: 14/04/2021

Original game developed by Micro Forté Pty. Ltd. for Commodore 64, published by Electronic Arts (USA) and U.S. Gold (Europe) in 1986.

results.brief_description: Fist II - The Legend Continues [computer game]. Fist II is a single player side scrolling beat ‘em up with adventure elements. Players travel through different environments, fighting various enemies, collecting items and visiting temples to power up the character to be strong enough to defeat the warlord and free the land.

results.title: Doc the Destroyer for ZX Spectrum 48/128
results.creator_credit: Geoff Evans, Paul Kidd, Melbourne House and Laser Beam (Beam Software)
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover and manual booklet in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Doc the Destroyer [computer game]. Doc the Destroyer is a side view, strategy arcade adventure in a post apocalyptic setting for one player. At the start of the game, players are given 60 points which they can distribute between five statistics Strength, Endurance, Intelligence, Luck and Charisma. As Doc, players are presented with various choices that determine your next action and some will throw the player into arcade styled combat.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoff Evans, Paul Kidd, Melbourne House and Laser Beam (Beam Software)
results.description: Doc the Destroyer [computer game]. Doc the Destroyer is a side view, strategy arcade adventure in a post apocalyptic setting for one player. At the start of the game, players are given 60 points which they can distribute between five statistics Strength, Endurance, Intelligence, Luck and Charisma. As Doc, players are presented with various choices that determine your next action and some will throw the player into arcade styled combat.

results.brief_description: Hungry Horace [computer game]. Hungry Horace is a top down single player arcade game similar to Pac Man. Players control Horace through a maze collecting flowers and guards lunches while avoiding capture by the park guards. Horace can ring alarms and frighten guards from the park. If Horace is caught three times, he is thrown out of the park and the game ends.
